values:
*Blows the dust  off ye olde eljay*  Wow, I can't believe it's been so long  since I posted an entry.. Does anyone ever READ  this thing anymore?  I'm guessing not. Everything's on twitter & FB now.  Still. may as well.  If you're still  writing on  Livejournal/care whether I ever update, post a comment.

Since my last entry:
I am  a year older (and a few months)
I am still with Ed
We are not married yet
I am still living with him & Ma
We moved
I am now minus a gallbladder (THAT was a fun adventure)
I still don't have a job
I am still broke as crap
Rachel has started College
I made a really good friend this summer
I have broken ties with  2 other friends
Still am friends with Clark, surprisingly.
I may have an opportunity to go back to school
I am going to the Feast of Tabernacles this year

I think that hits most of the high points  Sorry I have neglected you for so long, journal.

So many months since I posted last. Oh dear. Well let's see, I am officialy divorced, and I am proud of us, because we have remained friends.
Ed and I are still together and getting hitched in September ( Mark yer Calenders!). To Quote Jane Eyre:"I know no weariness of my Edward's society: he knows none of mine, any more than we each do of the pulsation of the heart that beats in our separate bosoms; consequently, we are ever together. To be together is for us to be at once as free as in solitude, as gay as in company. We talk, I believe, all day long: to talk to each other is but a more animated and an audible thinking. All my confidence is bestowed on him, all his confidence is devoted to me; we are precisely suited in character--perfect concord is the result."
Well, almost perfect, anyhow ;)
Finances are still tight,  we are moving this summer,  found a fab apartment, and I have GOT to start looking for work el Pronto! Other than that not much to report, I will try to post more often, I know my track record is lousy, so no promises! I will at least try to keep better track of everybody else in eljay land, I haven't forgotten you!

Hello all you happy people out there in eljay land. Hoipe ya'll have a great Turkey day tomorrow, mine will be delayed by a day, as my folks are coming up and we are getting together at my cousin Bobby's house on Friday. Ed's new job seems to be going well, we managed to get us enough groceries to last us, and I finally made it to the courthouse to file the paperwork needed for the divorce. All month long on Facebook, whenever I could get on , I have posted what i was thankful for... I'm very Thankful this year, and very very Happy. My Only wish for all of you is to feel likewise.. Happy Turkey Day!

Hard to Believe  it's Veteran's day and Ed and I have been together more than  2 months and still pretty much ridiculously happy together.   Our finances are still tight, and  there's no phone or 'Net at our house (Posting this from  a friend's) But he just got a  job, so things should be looking up financially soon.
As is my Tradition, I am posting this:

In Flanders Fields
By: Lieutenant Colonel John McCrae, MD (1872-1918)
Canadian Army

In Flanders Fields the poppies blow
Between the crosses row on row,
That mark our place; and in the sky
The larks, still bravely singing, fly
Scarce heard amid the guns below.

We are the Dead. Short days ago
We lived, felt dawn, saw sunset glow,
Loved and were loved, and now we lie
In Flanders fields.

Take up our quarrel with the foe:
To you from failing hands we throw
The torch; be yours to hold it high.
If ye break faith with us who die
We shall not sleep, though poppies grow
In Flanders fields.

. Happy Veterans Day to all. Most espically to our servicemen and Women.. may they all be home soon.

As per usual, when I neglect my ElJAy everything in my  life descends into complete chaos, and this hiatus has been no exception.  Clark's surgery was not a complete success, (at least not the way  he wanted it to be) and there were some complications.  I took care of  him post op as well as I could,  just like I have the  past  9 years of my life, but as usual. It wasn't  enough.  2 weeks ago, we made the decision to separate.. To be honest, there are things I'm amazed I've put up with for 9 years. You see, no matter what, I've always been as honest as I can with him. And I do have feelings for someone else (Mind you, up to that point I had not acted on those feelings) HIs response was that maybe we should separate.. To be honest, I was really surprised that he said this. I had been feeling distance between us, but assumed it was all on my end. After a couple more days of consideration, he told me that he didn't love me anymore, . The next day he'd changed his mind, but... Too late. (Turns our because of a medicine imbalance that he actually might have not been in his right mind when he said this... The unfortunate fact is he was still correct. He and I are holding each other back.) It was like someone has bopped me over the head and woken me up. He and I are just not good for each other, and that was the deciding factor. It wasn't just that I wanted out, and wanted to be with someone I AM way more compatible with (Although that is the case) I wanted to free him of me too. I don''t like the person I am when I'm with him She is spiteful, hateful and unhappy. I'm tired of living with her, and I'm sure Clark is, too.  As for my new guy, well, it's serious. We love each other, and  as is my MO, it happened really fast. Except for financial and logistical worries, I'm happier right now  that I have ever been   My New guy (His name is Ed BTW) and I have been friends for  a long time, but this being in love with each other thing is new. Except for hurting Clark , I have no regrets about my decision. I think I  would have  hurt him more in the  long run, I honestly do.  I feel I gave my marriage my best shot, and it is well past time for me to move on.    This Livejournal was established  during my first divorce, when I was trying to  get my feelings straight, and  trying to figure  out what I  wanted.  On the surface, it looks like history repeating itself, but I have grown older and a little wiser since then . (I hope)  Advice Comments and general Mojo would be appreciated, thanks. And I will try to update as best I can.

Posting this from sunny GA, right outside  Atlanta from the hotel we are staying in.  My Cousin Chris and his Fiancee Kira are getting married today!  Congratulations  guys! 

As Soon as I get back, we are going up to Cleveland  for Clark's surgery. Will post after that if I can. Love to all!

Crimitialy.
Do I need to post an update or what? Phew!

Ok I'll take this one thing at a  time :

Finances are  still in the crapper. I have a  job interview at 6:30 and Josh has a  job starting next month, so hopefully things will get better.   We have started our own business selling custom art and apparel (Check us out at http://www.myspace.com/penandpaletteimaging  )

Health.  I am having  a similar issue to the girly problem I had a couple years ago, I FINALLY have an appt  tomorrow to see about it. Cross for fingers for no more Bleedy outherwise, I am performing a self hysterectomy with  a rusty freeking spoon,

Clark and I just got back from Cleveland Clinic He had an appointment to  do an invasive EEG and we were up there for two weeks. The Seizures are coming  from two different places and the surgery will be more extensive than we had thought.  It should be about the middle toward the  end of July.

RIP Mrs Betty Assface Crickard ( A good friend of the family. And yes, there's a story behind the name)

I think that's most of the major stuff.
<lj-template name="qotd" id="817"></lj-template>Flight  of the Navigator .. It's still in my top ten.

.!. Despite being inspired my brother, I didn't make this list till Dave made me do it, nevertheless, I think I may learn a few things about myself as I share them with others.

2. Faithwise, I'm pretty muddled. My belief in God and Jesus Christ is crystal clear, the rest, well, I'm working on it.

3. .I hate funerals, and plan to have a party when i die.

4. I really love Children, and want my own.

5. I have been married twice, to the same man. It's working out a lot better the second time:) From him, I have learned that romance comes and goes, but love goes on and on.

6. I've been afraid to drive for years. My goal for 2009 is to end it being the proud owner of my driver's license, so stay off the sidewalks.

7. I've been a fan of Simon and Garfunkel since I can remember. Their music has had a profound impact on my life. and I try to share it with as many people as I can. I love music of all kinda, but they're still my favorite.

8. I'm not much of a drinker, but my favorite drink is Southern Comfort and Coke with a splash of lime.

9. I have the strangest dreams of almost anybody I know, but the really odd thing is that I recall them most of the time when I wake up. Also, I dream in color.

10. I know a lot of really really horrible jokes, and greatly enjoy inflicting them on other people. Mwahahahahaha.

11. I am a sentimental person. I cry easily, and I wear my heart on my sleeve. Some people see this as a weakness, but I don't. It's just the way I'm wired, and I can't really change it, I see it as a weakness, but also as a strength. I can't hide my feelings, but at least people know I am being honest.

12. I tell myself "bedtime stories" before I go to sleep. My two favorite ones are a (non sexual!) fantasy about Art Garfunkel, and one of me as a genius kid. I don't know why these two always put me to sleep, but they do, Perhaps it explains number 9.

13. I love cats. Mine sleeps with me every night, even though he is rotten.

14.I've got a stubborn streak a mile wide, but I think I can be reasoned with (at least most of the time)

15. I miss my Grandparents, all of them, a lot. (I am Grateful that some of my Great Aunts are still alive, and I think my Aunt Gerry could probably kick my ass in a fair fight.

16. I love Philly steak sandwiches. I think they are the world's most perfect food, and someday I'm going to Pennsylvania to eat a "real" one.

17. Is my Birthday, March 17, 1979. I Love my Birthday, in all of it's beery Green Irish glory.

18. Is my Brother's Birthday, the following Day and year from mine, my brother knows me better than anyone else in the world, probably. except for my husband, and like my husband uses this information to push my buttons, but also to sometimes know the exact right thing to say. Love ya, Jen.

19. The older I get, the faster time goes, in another ten years, I believe I will be approaching light speed.

20. I think that I am an ok singer, a pretty good cook, a fair masseuse and I try to be a good listener. I can also read really fast, have at least half a brain, and can type 30 WPM.

21. I have a bad temper, tend to be lazy, can't sew worth a damn, and can't draw a straight line with a ruler, also I'm hopelessly uncoordinated.

22. One thing I am most grateful for in my life is my parents. I have a stellar Mom and Dad. Everytime I think about them, it puts a smile on my face, and I realize that there are many who don't have this blessing

23 Politically, I'm pretty middle of the road. Much to my Daddy's chagrin, I do lean a bit left. I am registered as an independant.

24. If I could throw a dinner party and invite 9 people, living or dead, I would invite:Paul Simon, Art Garfunkel, My Grandma Treva,Amelia Earhart,Mick FoleyJanis Joplin,Gilda Radner,the Apostle Paul and Miss Piggy .
 

25. As I finish this list, I'm a bit chilly, a lot tired, smoking a cigarette, and listening to Harry Chapin. Hope you enjoyed reading this.

I think I better get my smokes for this one, because it may  be a looooong post. After all the  shit that went  down in October and November, it's been an ok month.  I've written a couple of times about the side effects of Clark's epilepsy , trying not to go into too much detail in order to protect his privacy.   We're now looking into brain surgery as an option. I was dead set against it first, I mean, how scary is that, if something goes wrong, , well, I don't like thinking about it.  On the other hand, I know how much  he struggles  with  not only the  effects of the seizures and their effect on his  cognition, but  the side effects of  his meds.  I want this for him,  to make  his  life better, and according to his epileptologist, it has a good chance of doing just that.  We also  found out that day that the Cleveland Clinic will pay for the tests, surgery, everything.. What  a Blessing that is! I also  got in touch with an old friend of mine that day, after  3 years of not speaking.. We had a falling out, well, actually not we, so much as she  just decided to  quit speaking to me, Our reconciliation lasted about a week :(  It's bummed me  out, to tell you the truth, I really did hope we could be  friends again.. I hope the surgery  situation doesn't  end up in similar disappointment  If for some reason, you're reading this , friend,. I wish  you no ill will, and hope maybe some day you can get your shit together, and we can be friends again.
I have learned something this year : the secret to being  happy is to focus what is going well in your life, and  what you have to be grateful for.  It's good to be able to vent, but that's all that some people do, and it  gets old after awhile. My goal for 2009 is to be  more positive, and yet more tolerant of negative people. I Also need to go back to work El Pronto. Clark is having test in Cleveland  starting the  4th of January. They are going to  take  him off his meds and monitor him with EEG and cameras. I feel it's very important that I be there, because he gets very confused when off the meds.  After that, though, I'm going back to my old job.  The Positive me, says I miss my friends there, and i enjoy helping people. It's a start, right?

Seems like the balls-to-the-wall period of the last few months is finally over. (knock on wood) After the last update ( that had some relevance to my actual life) Clark was in the hospital due to some neurological stuff.. I hope things are calming down finally.. I need to quit being so lazy too. It has caused me a lot of problems.. If I'm going to be House bitch I need to at least do a good job of it, so i'm trying to get my act together. Clark and I are also trying to get our shit together. Marriage is emotionally exhausting sometimes, no,  a lot of the time. I would say, on the whole, however, that it is worth it. Also I will try to update my story soon, if anyone is still interested in it.

This is an as-yet-untitled story I'm working on.. My thanks to  for the  inspiration! Please  leave some feedback!

An auburn haired girl sat under the beech tree, outside the campus library, her nose in a book. She was oblivious to the world around her, so when Robin Berkeley's dog stole one of the shoes laying on the ground next to her, she didn't even notice, at first.

" Marcus!! Bad Dog!! Come here. Sit!!" The black lab mix obediently trotted back to his owner, the contraband in his mouth dropped at his master's feet with a sheepish doggie grin.

Robin approached the girl with her slightly-the-worse-for-wear shoe. "I'm really sorry about that. Big goofy bastard got away from me"

Fortunately, the girl didn't look too pissed. "That's ok, I should have been keeping better track of them, I just got caught up in my book."

"Warfare at Sea, 1850-1880: Maritime Conflicts and the Transformation of Europe" Sounds..interesting"

She laughed. "Actually it, is, believe it or not: It's for a class I'm taking." She took the shoe from him with a bright smile, and Robin felt his heart do a little back flip.

"I'm Robin" he said, offering the hand that was not attached to Marcus' leash.

"Phoebe." she said, taking it. Her hands were warm, and soft, and Robin felt his heart twitch again. "Actually, I have to get to class, but it was nice meeting you.."

" Hey, um..when you get out of class, would you like to get a cup of coffee, or something?" Oh Geez, Rob, real smooth.

But Phoebe was nodding. "I'd love to; Meet you back here at a quarter after?"

"Sounds great. I'll see you then."

Robin's feet barely touched the earth as he walked Marcus home.

* * *

Phoebe McCoy checked her hair in the ladies room mirror as soon as class was over. She didn't want to keep Robin waiting, but a girl's got to look her best, right? She sighed, wishing she looked like one of those Barbie doll types she saw on campus, the ones with perfect hair, perfect makeup, perfect breasts and bodies. The girls who looked put together by professionals, who never had pimples, or cold sores, or ... corns! She laughed ruefully. She was a bit surprised that a guy who looked like Robin had even given her the time of day. It's like polishing a turd. She thought. I don't have so much as a lip gloss on me to improve things. She sighed again, made one last attempt to smooth her hair and went to go meet Robin.

He was standing under the beach tree outside the library and smiled at her as she approached.

"Hey, How was class?"

"Oh, not too bad, I guess." She smiled wishing he wasn't looking at her so intensely. Maybe she had food on her shirt, or something. If only she didn't feel so self-conscious!

"Who do you have?"

"Palmer."

He grinned. " He's an pompous ass. I had him last semester."

She giggled, "Yeah, maybe. He makes you think, though"

"So, Student Union, for the coffee?"

"Yeah, that sounds good."

They walked towards the Student Center. Robin found himself fascinated with the way the girl moved.. she turned to him, finally.

" Do I have food in my teeth or something?"

"Well, no, of course not, why??

"You keep looking at me so odd."

Robin blushed to the roots of his hair. "No, of course not. It's just, well, you're very pretty."

She snorted. "Are you kidding me? I got no makeup on, no fashionable clothes, my hair is barely brushed..."

"So what?" he said. None of that matters a damn to me, if you were a queen bedecked with jewels you wouldn't be any better looking than you are now.."

She looked at him quizzically. "Do you really mean that?"

" I do." Now it was Phoebe's turn to blush. "Screw this." Robin said. "Let's go back to my place."

"Not to overuse a cliché, but what kind of girl do you think I am?"

"Dunno," he said, "but I'd sure like to find out."

"Good enough for me." she said.

They headed back to Robin's place.

* * *

Five hours later, it was, well, five hours later. Marcus lay curled up, snoring, at their feet. Phoebe couldn't remember the last time she'd felt so comfortable with anybody, let alone a strange guy she'd just met earlier that day. They were sitting cross legged on Robin's battered futon, facing each other, they'd talked about art, politics, music, touched on religion and history, and generally lost all track of the time. The were in the middle of a heated discussion about The Office when Robin finally looked at the clock.

"Holy Mackerel It's past 8."

"You've got to be joking!" But no, the clock told the sad truth. "Aw, I hate that! I really got to be going, though, Oh, Robin, How glad I am that Marcus stole my shoe!" She bent to scratch the sleeping Lab behind one of his floppy ears.

He walked her to the door. "Not as glad as I am. At the risk of sounding like Scary Stalker Guy it seems as if.."

"...We've known each other forever?"

He beamed. "Yes, that's it exactly. When can I see you again?"

"I'll be at the library tomorrow."

They looked at one another, both feeling the connection that needed no words. He took her hand in both of his, and kissed her gently. Their first kiss, the first of many, he hoped, and watched wistfully at the window until she was no longer in sight.

Well, I guess it's well past time I updated my journal, although be thankful I didn't take 6 years to do it, unlike some people I could mention.

My friend Diane Passed away October 8th of this year 5 years almost to the very day that her husband Jack did. Clark & I went down to Hton to help get her affairs straightened out and to have a memorial service for her. When we came back, we discover the power had been cut off due to lack of payment.. and has been off till yesterday. Needless to say, it's been a Crappy few weeks, especially, since I have caught some kind of Respiratory crud from the household here.

Fortunately, the lights are back on now, I seem to be recovering okay from the crud and I have had my friends to cheer and warm me (they know who they are.. *lick*) Now begins the process of cleaning up this nasty house & getting everything back to normal.. thanks muchly to buster and fionaviolette for letting me crash at their place.

BWAHAHAHA. Thanks suneccubus

Ten Top Trivia Tips about Janis_and_co!

  1. More than one million stray dogs and half a million stray cats live in Janis_and_co!
  2. The Australian billygoat plum contains a hundred times more Vitamin C than Janis_and_co.
  3. It is bad luck to walk under Janis_and_co.
  4. Czar Paul I banished Janis_and_co to Siberia for marching out of step.
  5. Moles are able to tunnel through 300 feet of Janis_and_co in a day!
  6. The fingerprints of Janis_and_co are virtually indistinguishable from those of humans, so much so that they could be confused at a crime scene.
  7. Only fifty-five percent of men wash their hands after using Janis_and_co!
  8. Ostriches stick their heads in Janis_and_co not to hide but to look for water!
  9. In the Great Seal of the United States the eagle grasps 13 arrows and Janis_and_co.
  10. Finding Janis_and_co on Christmas morning is believed to bring good luck!
I am interested in - do tell me about

Our little one is back!! Josh found her the morning after she disappeared. The night before, I said a prayer that my kitty would come back to me. The next day, I woke up with a hinky weird feeling that I should check the porch. "Nahh" I told myself "she won't be out there" "but you should look" said the little voice in my brain. Well, I opened my bedroom door & there she was!  Josh found her surrounded  by dogs, too so he got her just in time. I truly believe it was Divine Intervention.  I also believe if the Lord can look out for the little sparrows, and my kitty, that I'll be okay too. (Especially  since I found out they started a couple a really heinous policies at work the day after I quit._

I know (again!!) That it's been  a long while since I posted, so I really hate making a entry just to whinge, but to paraphrase Leslie Gore "it's my journal & I'll whinge if I want to.."

Wednesday, Al & I caught a stray kitty  at work & brought her home, by Wednesday night, we'd decided to keep her. Thursday, we Had a big fight during the gaming session. Friday we had a big fight at the store, Saturday, I lost my job. Today our new kitty ran away.
Fuck you, World.

April 2, 2008 is the First Annual World Autism Awareness day. My Goddaughter & my youngest Nephew are autistic, so this is very important to me.

My Best Friend's Grandad passed away last week, so I went down to H-ton last week to be with her & the family. Momaw & Popaw have been very good to me , & I really wanted to be there for them. I feel shitty though, because Angel & her family were going to come up this weekend & we can't do that. The work schedules conflict :(

While I  was down in West virgina, my mother had A PAT attack (She had a pacemaker put in earlier this month) & my stepdad is mad at me because I didn't go to the hospital right away. That was a big hecak, & he is still mad.

If you read this LJ or know me from online  post a reply to this entry, please. I feel like I don't really have any close friends online anymore, & I miss that.

On a more positive note.
I had a birthday earlier this month & I got lotsa neat goodies, plus also I am getting ready to run  a Hackmaster Game on Thursdays.

WOW
Lotsa things going on here, 
havoc_fox
moved in, and added to my Growing geekboy collection, things are shifing  at work & all  kinda hairy shit going on. Had Steller Valentines!
Hope all is well for everybody else!

*waves*
Yep. Still living.  Went to the Doc & am on hormones   They stopped the bleedy really quick.  My period came at the usual ( I think) time. Hopefully, it will be of normal duration ( sorry for the TMI)
Christmas was good. I got spoiled rotten as usual, and  we got a new (to us) vehicle to boot!
The loot:
A shocking pink  body pillow
Rachel Ray's 30 minute meals
this poster 
potato peeling gloves 
A veggie chopper
a handmade mini cutting board
We Are Marshall DVD
Really cool rainbow measuring spoons
2 pairs of socks
 supersoft bathrobe , blue.
A Simon & Garfunkel Book  
A snowflake pin
A Hand made basket, from my mother(pair of earrings a compact that Belonged to my Mimi, &  a lemon Candle)
tea light candles
A flower power magnet
 kitchen timer
Bottle of Tabu
New Birks (YAY)
Frying pan
Mono (and African sleeping sickness!)

& prolly a couple other things I forgot to mention... Thank you to everybody!

Now, about the Car. A couple weeks ago, Clark's Dad sent us some $$$ for x-mas so we could get a car. The neon is  still in fairly good shape, but it's getting old & requires a fair bit of maintainence.  Friday, we picked up a 2003 Chevy Caviler.  I will post piccies as soon as I take some.  I think there was enough Joy & light this Christmas to see me though the  rest of the suck-y winter.

Happy New Year, All!
Count yer blessings

oh, plus also


Why did the koala fall out of the tree?

Because somebody threw a refrigerator at him.

Why did the koala fall out of the tree?

Because he was holding hands with the first koala.

Why did the koala fall out of the tree?

Because he thought it was a new trend.

Why did the koala fall out of the tree?

Peer pressure.

Why did the koala fall out of the tree?

Somebody threw another refrigerator.

Why did the boy fall off of his bike?

Well, he was riding under a tree, and all of the sudden he got hit with five koalas and two refrigerators.

I Apologize.

One of these days, I really will post more, I swear :) Matter of fact, I was prodding

havoc_fox 
to post in his  journal, & figured I better post  something, too, so's not to be a hypocrite.  Winter depresses me.  The days are shorter, colder & darker.  2007 has been a rough year, I  did not adjust to moving very well, & as usual I take others' troubles onto myself.
I lost my friend David this month.  I miss his insight, his warmth, his wisdom, his humor, and his fanatical devotion to the Beatles. As  I said at his funeral, it was an honor, and a privilege, to be his friend.
I'm glad Thanksgiving was the day after the service.  It served as a distraction & was a  lot of fun, all things considered. Food & fun were had by all. I am still having female problems. It's worrisome &  a general PITA.  I'm not sure if I can get checked out till I quit the bleedy, but we'll see.  I'm looking forward to Christmas, despite the usual money woes, especially spending it with Clark,who really is a dollbaby when he wants to be.  Today is our 
un-iversary, which means if we had stayed married, we'd been married 6 years.  I've learned a lot from him, and from being married to him, and even from having been divorced. I guess winter, while it has it's downside it a good time for reflection, on  our lives, and on who we are, and who  we  are meant to be, on our lost loves and dreams for the future.
Stay warm!

In Flanders Fields
By: Lieutenant Colonel John McCrae, MD (1872-1918)
Canadian Army
IN Flanders FIELDS the poppies blow
Between the crosses row on row,
That mark our place; and in the sky
The larks, still bravely singing, fly
Scarce heard amid the guns below.

We are the Dead. Short days ago
We lived, felt dawn, saw sunset glow,
Loved and were loved, and now we lie
In Flanders fields.

Take up our quarrel with the foe:
To you from failing hands we throw
The torch; be yours to hold it high.
If ye break faith with us who die
We shall not sleep, though poppies grow
In Flanders fields.

I know it's been a long time since I have posted in my eljay, I just get lazy, for the most part, sometimes i get genuinely busy, & now I have to share the PC with an additional person & I have to wait my turn.. However, something rather significant may have happened this week... OTOH, it may not be a bit significant... Clark & i have been trying to get pregnant for some time, or more specifically, not trying to prevent it. Yesterday, I took a pregnancy test, because, instead of starting my period when I was supposed to, I spotted for 24 hours & then stopped.. Now, I always bleed like someone killed me & I cramp like a bastard, too. The test ( I got it done at a clinic) was negative. I was so disappointed. Also, now I am puzzled. Why is my body acting odd? Medically, I got some very good advice from my Dad, so I am not too worried. Just puzzled. And bummed. If Aunt Flo doesn't come in ernest this week, I have another appointment for a followup pregnancy test. I know there is such a thing as a false negative. I hope that's what it is.

So, posting from the Sunshine State... Finally on  my vacation.. i really wanted to post an entry before i left but my keyboard at home is wacked... I hope the boys fix it before I return.
Having a lovely time down here & I will try to post some pictures.. today  we are going to Sarasota...

also one of those analyzer thingies told me I'm conventional..
 RAT BOOGIES RAT BOOGIES RAT BOOGIES RAT BOOGIES

there. I hope that helps.
Well  we moved. & it's been fucking horrible..  nothing I really want to get into right now... because I have a cold & the Curse. so maybe my perceptions are skewed.
Well,  it's official... We got the apartment and are moving the 24th of this  month.. *takes a deep breath* here we go......   Plus also i  won  a bunch of cool stuff  at work this week... go me.

Yesterday, Josh  went & bought  a new truck.. it's a big silver F150 & it's rare that I've seen Josh so pleased about something... He's giddy as a little girl.  Since he  found out he could get financing, he's been talking  about taking a second job to afford the truck  payment, but he  also thought of  the  old idea of moving in together to save  expenses... & it looks like that is what we're going to do... As of this morning,  Clark says he's officially on board... 

Josh  took  us the other day to see an Apartment  at the Brookville. It's a little complex about 5 mins from here... Could I live there.?.. i think so, it seems  awfully small for  3 people, but they have finished basements, and work actually  has been going better, tho so... hmm.
Maybe I need a change, but I really don't want to leave my home, &  having roommates seems a step backwards, still the Brookville is a nice place, much nicer than where we are now... it has a pool & everything. I'm not sure  how to feel about this yet...

Well, I had  a pretty good birthday, all things being equal.. Had my "official" B-day party Friday night. There was Green cake , Green booze, green decorations  & lots of nifty loot.  One of the things I got was a gift certificate for a massage,  which  was cashed in the next day, (Thank We also saw Wild Hogs on Saturday, got  Gyros & went to Renie's to do Kareoke Oh & i got  The Columbia Recordings with my b-day money, so YAY me.  The week started on a sour note, Last night I found out that  a buddy of mine at work was going to be fired, but apparently he got  a reprieve. I'm so glad. Work would suck way worse without him. So, I'm in a pretty good mood & I'm going to sneak-post this.

*pokes her head in*
Wow, kinda dusty in here. My usual lack of  follow through has bitten me in my  vast ass once again. Alive? Check. Well? Reasonably.
Ok that out of the way, here are some things I'm thinking about:

Craig Ferguson is the man.



George Takai is also the man

 

 Now this runs into a debate: what's funny?  To be sure, scheudenfreude is quickly becoming  the in thing.  Where do we draw the line? When does it stop being funny?  & how do people deal with laughing at something, that , when they stop to think about it, makes them uncomfortable?  On the  Ferguson clip, listen to the people's laughter, they just don't know how to take what he is saying seriously. They've come to this taping expecting to laugh, but some things are not funny. I know. Alcoholism runs on both sides of my family.. It's destroyed the lives of people i care about.  Wreaked havoc on their health, killed them. Is that funny?  Is poking the stick at people who are fighting a battle that most people loose funny, no matter what the amount of money they have or the personal choices they've made ?. Craig says no, & I agree. As for the Takai clip, How okay is it to attack someone for their belief, not that I'm saying what Hardaway said is okay, in any way shape or form, I don't agree with that he said,  again, this issue hits close to home for me. I have friends and loved ones that self identify as Gay, Straight, Bisexual, asexual.  Perhaps the best lesson learned here that it's not okay to hate. it's not okay to hate celebrities, it's not okay to hate homophobes, it's not okay to hate ANYBODY. & hate is not a funny thing. You can hate people's actions, yes. You can hate someone's opinions.  Disagreement and dissent ion is the hallmark of intelligent debate. Where do  we draw the line at what is not acceptable?  Some have argued  that Takai is essentially  joking about rape here. Is that his point?  Is he simply pointing how ludicrous is it to openly voice hateful opinions about  homosexual people in this day  and age.   Can it be said That "Sometimes the only way to deal with something deadly serous is to try to treat it a little lightly" (Mrs Which, A Wrinkle in Time) Certainly we all have done this... Yet everyone has a personal line which they draw when something no longer is funny. Perhaps the best thing  to do  is respect each other's personal lines.  Perhaps. On the other hand,  would  we become so damn politically correct and censored that people felt afraid to say  what they thought for fear of offending someone? It's not a black and white issue.

I spent all weekend  shopping.  is it any wonder that I didn't want to go back to work, well is it any wonder anyway, considering that i increasingly hate my job?  I cannot wait for  next week, i need to get out of town so bad.
Ever since September it seems like  life just hasn't let up.  I had a friend die this week. &  a friend of a friend  died 2 weeks ago.
It's not been  a good 4 months.
Please let this trip go smoothly That's all I ask. I need this so badly.

I Wrote this on the spur of the moment...
I still miss him.

A laugh on the wind,
A wink from a friend
Something dirty that makes us smile
A Quiet rainy Day
There's somthin' about LA
That we've been missing for awhile.

I hope you know how much your're missed,
I hope you know how much we cared
we hope you won't forget us
Up there in Joker's Heaven

A email that's funny
Chicken snot that's runny 
It's odd what makes us think of you
When we see our fellow man
try to lend a helping hand
We know that's what you'd want us to do

I hope you know how much your're missed,
I hope you know how much we cared
we hope you won't forget us
Up there in Joker's Heaven

Maybe God's an auctary
or anything but ordinary
It's natures greatest mystery after all
Just wanted to say
you're missed every day
How could we ever forget our Paul?

I hope you know how much your're missed,
I hope you know how much we cared
We know you won't forget us
Up there in Joker's Heaven

Last night I talked to Lara, an acquaintance of mine who used to be married  to my buddy Billy. I've met her once before,  She came to our place one night while him & her were still dating  & I  was living at Chez Geek & I cooked dinner for everybody & she & I bonded over a couple glasses of wine &  discussed things about Billy no one else knows *grin* Besides both knowing *ahem* Billy,  We pretty much have both run in the same social circles.  Anyhow, we talked for a good long time last night, & I  really enjoyed it, It was a nice game of "Do you remember " & Oh my Gawd, what happened to so-and-so"?  I look forward to talking to her again, her & Billy split up ages ago, & she's living in Colorado. After I went to bed, I lay there & watched Clark sleeping & I  thought for awhile about our conversation.  She made me realize how different things are now than they were. I have a stable home, I've held down  a job for more than  a year, I'm married & have stayed that way  (at least thus far) There's just no constant drama going on anymore. I guess the Grow-the-Fuck-Up Fairy waved her magic wand  & on some it took & some it didn't.  I miss the people I knew then. Sometimes I miss the person I was then. the severing of some of those relationships gave me a lot of pain.  My phone still works. I'd be glad to hear from any of them, but, somehow,  I doubt I will.  
It was a pretty uneventful weekend. I got some cleaning done Thursday &  Friday & then Friday afternoon Me & Donna went to lunch & to the Thrift store & I got  a new (to me) cordless phone- YAY! No more having to break my fingers trying to dial  a number.
I slept really late today, but i caught the end of the Ohio State/Michigan game, which I  am firmly convinced we won because of my Uncle Robert since it was his Birthday.. 
Well it's the start of another workweek, & I am looking forward to Thanksgiving. Have a good week, GO BUCS!

Even though I didn't really know what to vote FOR.  At least I got the Heekack over my name misspelling cleared up.  After that, I picked up some breakfast & some black nail polish before it goes off Halloween discount, YAY!  Also, I have a movie date with a Buddy of mine to see a  Documentary at the Drexel on Thurs. Also, things are looking pretty good at work tonight.
Clark & I have been at odds, & the problem seems to be getting worse. Why can't everything ever balance out?

This is a letter from Clark about the circumstances of him getting fired,
 any advice would be helpful, thanks! 



I swear to you this speeding ticket was not obtained through negligence or recklessness.

I began my employment with ("Rent-a-car") resolved to never speed in a company car. And for a while, I kept
this up. But day after day, I was subjected to comments such as: "We're always beating you back to
the office because you don't speed. We all do it. That policy is no big deal." (This is not a direct
quote, but a conglommeration of dozens of statements.) Like I was a blooming imbecile for obeying the
speed limit. No matter what your mindset, hearing such statements repeatedly from everyone around
you (supervisors or not) has an impact on you. Any good advertiser can tell you: repetition sells.

Add to this the fact that in my driving duties, I was sometimes ordered to follow one of my supervisors in a
2nd vehicle without even being told the destination, to save time in hurried circumstances. Often on these
trips, I was essentially forced to speed to keep up with my leading, speeding supervisor. For if I was
separated from them by traffic, I had no way of knowing where to go next -- which would mean being late, &
management wouldn't be happy about that. Of course, this dilemma could be solved by a simple cel phone
call, except that I can't afford one & Enterprise doesn't provide them.
The worst of the speeding supervisors was Brian. This is in no way meant to indicate
that he's an inept driver. Quite the opposite. From his point of view, he knows his limits as a driver, and he
enjoys pushing himself to the limit. On a few occasions, he also enjoyed pushing me to (or past) my limits.

So "why am I the one who got ticketed?", you may be asking. I wish I knew. I have such bad luck,
sometimes I think I'm cursed. I wasn't even passing other drivers when either of these tickets occurred.
I was simply moving with the flow of traffic. Whenever I go the exact posted speed limit on a freeway,
virtually all other drivers zoom past me, some of them irritated-enough to cut me off.

I am a safe, consciencious driver. Unfortunately, I've found that on Columbus (& vicinity) freeways, brief
speeding is sometimes essential to not missing your exit -- due in some cases to poor sign placement,
in other cases to having your view of the signs blocked by SEMI trucks in front of & beside of you. I've
also found that on Columbus freeways, brief speeding is sometimes essential to avoiding an accident
due to the negligent or reckless actions of other drivers. I have yet to have a collision in a Rent-a-car
vehicle, but I can tell you there have been at least 2 occasions on which one probably would have occurred
had I not briefly sped to prevent it. I think it's safe to say I served ("Rent-a-car")'s wants & needs
on those occasions, in spite of having to break company policy to do it.


REGUARDING MY 7/19/06 SPEEDING TICKET:
This is the most complex issue this letter addresses, and I think you'll find if you put yourself in my
shoes, it could happen to you just as easily. Chances are, if this tale doesn't infuriate you, it'll
probably amuse you.

I was driving along on I-270 at a speed that kept me with the flow of traffic. Traffic in most lanes
was heavy (including a few SEMI's), which made me feel as though I needed to divert into the less
crowded fast lane, for my assignment did have a deadline. As I moved into a construction area
(indicated by orange markers), I looked diligently for speed reduction signs, while continuing to
glance at my speedometer every 2 - 3 seconds, as is my habit. I saw no such signs, & naturally
presumed the only speed thwe law could hold me to was the last one posted where drivers could
see it (65 mph).

When in the fast lane, one tends to be more of a driving hazard if one does not speed (at least a
little), so I proceeded at 70 mph (to my knowledge, 5 mph over the limit -- & I'd never met anyone
pulled over for that), with intent to slow down as soon as I was able to get out of the fast lane.
However, I never got that chance, as a moment later, a free-standing traffic cop (with his patrol
car parked in the left shoulder) waved me over. Another civilian vehicle was parked on the
shoulder adjacent to the patrol car, so just a split-second earlier, I had presumed the officer wasn't
finished with him, yet. I concluded that if I didn't stop, he was going to chase me, so I pulled over.

When he told me I was in a 55 mph zone, I was astounded. "What?!", was my 1st response.
I then told him there were no such speed limit signs behind me -- that the nearest signs said 65.
He swore there were 2 such signs in the past 2 miles. I didn't believe him, but my memory (both
short & long term) has always had some peculiar flaws, so I am forced to doubt myself. This is
why I am so detail-oriented. However, I happened to encounter another rent-a-car driver/car prep
3 days later when she had brief business at my branch. She told me she remembered seeing
me on the 19th on I-270 & wanted to thank me for slowing to let her into my lane (This was before
I got into the fast lane.). She also said she remembered seeing me get pulled over a few minutes
later, & when I spoke of the elleged speed reduction signs I never saw, she said she never saw
them, either. I had already decided to contest this ticket in court, but she was elderly & I didn't
want to burden her with a court appearance. All I know of her is her first name is Betty. Anyway,
this brief conversation with Betty made me far more convinced in the long run that the elleged
signs were never actually there.

Anyway, the officer said: "I clocked you once at 71 and once at 73." If that's even true, I can
swear that either it was only for a split second while my eyes were on traffic rather than my
speedometer, or this Enterprise vehicle's speedometer was reading a little off the mark.

One might say I should have demanded the officer show me the elleged signs before writing the
ticket. This actually crossed my mind for a split second. I didn't for 3 reasons.
1. It would have delayed me for at least another 25 minutes, undoubtedly causing customer
dissatisfaction & making both me & my branch look bad.
2. If the officer even consented, it would have angered him, likely resulting in a larger fine if
the speed reduction signs were there (My view on the 1st pass could simply have been blocked
by SEMI trucks, I thought at this time.).
3. I incorrectly thought at this time that it took 3(not 2) tickets to get me fired.
American courts tend to hinge more on how much money you spend on a lawyer than they do on
the truth & I had no money to spend on a lawyer. I knew from past experience that appearing in
court was my only chance to work off the fine through community service rather than paying cash.
That's what I did for the February ticket in Dublin. Also, for a ticket a few years earlier in another
county, the magistrate had to dismiss the citation altogether simply because the ticketing officer
failed to show up at the court proceeding. These were my hopes.

When I showed up for court on 8/9/06, I was called up to the prosecutor to enter a plea (before
court proceedings began). Being without representation, I had only the prosecutor's word to rely
on as to what plea was in my best interests to enter. She told me entering a plea of "not guilty"
meant that the matter would not be resolved today. Rather, I'd have to return at a later date for
trial (Today was just a hearing/arrainment.)(more court costs). Thus, I learned that different
counties use vastly different procedures. The prosecutor next told me that if I pled "guilty" and
just paid the $130 fine, she would work it so that there would be no points added to my driver's
license. But I wouldn't get to present my version of events to the court. I came to get my say.
I asked if I'd be allowed to pay the fine in 3 separate installments. She said yes.
She said if I pled "no contest" that I wouldn't actually be admitting guilt & would have to pay a
fine & court costs, but would have a chance of getting the fine reduced, & that procedure would
require that the magistate ask me to present my version of events, if I wanted to. The
prosecutor clearly confirmed this twice at my request. I was as anal as anal can be about
avoiding any miscommunications in this matter. So I entered a plea of "no contest".

When called before the magistrate, with barely an utterance out of my mouth (a confirmation of
my plea, I believe), the magistrate clearly stated my sentence is to be a $30 fine + $75 court
costs. I told her of my low financial status & asked if I could work off the fine through community
service. She said no. I asked if I would have the option to pay the fine in, say, 3 separate
installments to make it easier on my budget. She said yes. She never asked me to present my
version of events. I didn't press it, because all things considered, a $30 fine was apparently the
best deal I could have hoped for, & if I angered her by "wasting the court's time", she probably
would've ammended that sentence to something worse.

So, we've established that the prosecutor told me a lie about procedure which influenced my
decision about which plea to enter --- or that the magistrate simply violated that procedure.

I next proceeded to the deputy court clerk within the courtroom (as instructed) to complete
paperwork pertaining to the results of this proceeding. The clerk told me the total bill was $130,
same as the original ticket. A little too convenient, if you ask me. And way off what the magistrate
said, just a couple minutes ago. So I demanded to know the details of this equasion. For starters,
the paperwork handed over to this clerk by the magistrate states a $50(not $30) fine. Add $75 court
costs and this still leaves $5 unaccounted for. So, clearly grasping at straws, the clerk then told
me there's a $5 "continuence fee". He claims this is for the 3 month payment extention I
requested, but as soon as I've made it clear to him that I intend to pay this in installments, he's
telling me it is not permissible to pay this in installments -- that it must be paid LUMP SUM
(only at a later date).

Now it's been established that the magistrate lied to me from the bench. She could not have
misunderstood my question. I was quite precise. Of course, it's too late for me to change my plea.
To continue: I responded to the deputy clerk: "Well that won't help me at all. I'd rather just pay it
all today." He next indicated quite clearly to me that if I pay it all today, the $5 fee will be removed.
Yet somehow, the final total remained the same. He then told me he had almost forgot there was a
second (although 1st, chronologically) continuance fee, reguarding my request for a change in the
date of my arrainment. "That wasn't a request for a continuance, I was requesting that my court
date be moved up, not back," I said. "well, apparently the magistrate saw it as one," he replied.

Thus, the final bill remained $130. How suspiciously convenient. This court is corrupt.

Imagine how you'd feel if you got stuck with an 18 mph over the speed limit ticket when you had
every reason to believe you were only going 5 mph over it (& briefly) --- a violation for which I
wouldn't have gotten pulled over, considering other drivers right next to me were going at least 10
mph over the limit (65 in the elleged 55).

I've sought legal council on the prospect of suing Franklin County over this, and been told that
although my complaint is valid, no one will take the case because it is simply unwinnable.
However, the search goes on.

I loved my job at ("Rent-a-car"), and losing it has devestated me both financially and emotionally.
I would swear to the above facts on a stack of Bibles & on my grandmother's grave. And anyone
who has worked with me for a signifigant length of time can tell you I'm honest to a fault (I'm
sure some of them even make fun of me over it.).


Sincerely,

Clark D. Andrews
5920 Maple Canyon Ave. Apt. E
Columbus, OH 43229

(614) 899-1542

artofclark@hotmail.com

P.S.-- If you have any suggestions that you think might help bring justice to this situation,
please contact me.

Clark  lost his job last week. The good news is he got another one today.  The bad news is that it's monday thru froday, evening shift..  Which means we have no days off together & virtually no time to spend with each other. I spent my first evening alone for this reason & it was pretty depressing, I mean, it's not a huge deal or anything, but, I can't help feeling crappy about it.. i downloaded a few songs to make myself feel better, Billy Joel's Leningrad & a couple of Grateful Dead songs that I hadn't heard in ages, I suppose because they remind me of things I'd rather forget.

Wow, I'm tired... It's all I can do to stay awake... I was up at 10 am, & I tried to take a nap before work, but I couldn't fall asleep, so I ended up laying awake listening to SVU for an hour.. So now I'm at work, fighting sleep.. Pretty busy weekend, Wednesday we were going to go to some nearby caverns ( http://www.olentangyindiancaverns.com) but they were closed by the time we got there, so we settled on going there thursday. I really haven't quite come to terms with that yet... I do know if he could see what it's done for the board, where everybody is pulling together, comforting each other, becoming even closer, well, i think he'd be pleased. Friday I baked a loaf of bread, did a little housecleaning, & bought some soil at Lowes & planted an herb garden I started earlier this week. I'm growing garlic, sweet basil, oregano, rosemarry, purple sage &peppermint.. Looks nice. Tonight I took a few clippings of the basil & made a nice pesto for chicken, which turned out yummy, I hope they grow... I'm not great with plants. We played Star Wars RISK too.. fun! anyway, now I am a sleepy hippie & I'm counting the minutes till 8 am.. Goodnight!

Well, here I am at work, yuk, but I thought if I actually posted an entry, it might make the time pass faster. I need to get some stuff to put in my cubicle at work, not that 's it's " official", mind you, but, according to the powers that be, we do get to kinda call 'dibs' for our spaces back here in Product Lab & so far, all I have in mine is my posted schedule & my notebook & folder. I'm glad that nobody's taken my stuff yet, I keep leaving it & & since it seems to be safe, I'd like to maybe bring a picture or two from home, or something. I did end up buying that chair, but it BROKE less than a week later! Arg stupid #^(*&$# cheapass $#!*! & Waterbeds n' Stuff wouldn't give me my money back either, I got store credit, so I bought some things for my living room, to change it's look a bit. I wish I had been able to get the money, because I ended up being overdrawn on my account, & I have to straighten up that this payday. Speaking of accounts, Yahoo has Yanked mine. WHY!? I sent them an email about it, but all I got in return was one of those stupid automated things in return, I sent another, but I haven't heard back from them yet, so If you're on my yahoo buddylist & you don't hear from me for awhile, well, that's why :( this is my last night of work this week, seems like the week has just flown by. I ended up liking this 4 day on, 3 day off schedule a lot more than I thought I would. The nights seem long at the time, but it's not really so bad. I'm going to try to get some new glasses tomorrow. Mine broke a few weeks ago, & I've been wearing an old pair. I hope I can find ones I like I seem to see fewer & fewer frames at the store that suit my face, the teeny little granny frames just don't do it for me. I have always put a lot of thought into the glasses I get because I must wear them ALL the time.  Hope all is well with you guys out there in eljayland.
Peace.
Janis

After getting absofrikkinlutely NOTHING done yesterday, except to mend a pair of pants (Yay! I have my hoochie-mama jeans back!) I was a busy Beth today. I picked up & cashed my paycheck (and two other checks) , Scrubbed my stove, cleaned my living room, did my dishes, wiped the counters, cleaned the garbage disposal, dusted, mopped the floor & went out to eat & window shopping. I didn't get very much sleep today, but it was worth it. After picking up my check, & getting my housework done, i went to bed for awhile. Tonight was Date night, so when Clark got home, he woke me so we could get ready & Go out.. First stop was Wal-Mart. I wanted to get my ears re-pierced. The holes are still open, but I want some piercing studs, so my earrings won't fall out & get lost anymore, but alas, where I have been wearing cheapo earrings, one of my hole is widened from being repeatedly irritated & is about to split. *sigh* I ended up getting a pair of small clasp type hoops ( 14K gold ) to keep in them till they heal, i also got the cleaning solution, & I'm going to put neosporin on my earlobe too, I knew my ear was a bit sore, but I never thought it was in that bad a shape.. lesson, kiddies: Don't wear cheap earrings for long periods of time. I also got a pair of 14k ball earrings to go in the top, & hypo-allergenic ones for the bottom. Clark bought me flowers to cheer me up. I mean it was such a little silly thing, but,  he wanted to make me feel better. i really don't know how I got so lucky. Anyway, there's a     leather chair I want to buy at Waterbeds N stuff but I had spend exactly too much of the ear stuff to get it.. Clark woulda loaned me a few bucks, but i was  a bit torn about making such  a large purchase anyway. But you know what, I loaned a friend a bit of money & He's going to pay me back this week &  i  am going to get it tomorrow.  Period. No more pussy-ing around.
After that we went out to eat at Chilli's. Everything was yummers. The food was so good Clark didn't even bitch about the bill *L*
Well, I'm going to 'moke a cigarette,  call my buddy Tim & go to bed... Been a pretty productive day.
